intro: Alismorkis puberula, commonly known as the slender water plantain, is a herbaceous aquatic plant native to North America. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater wetlands and ponds, often submerged or partially submerged. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences and bloom in late spring to early summer. Alismorkis puberula plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
